title: The fact that a champion like reworked Akali could make it to live is a joke
body: Why does an assassin have this much healing and safety? She can attack you under your own tower and her kit has so much resource regen she doesn't really have to micro manage anything. Meanwhile I'm trying to improve my GP play and my W has a longer cooldown and much stricter cost than her shroud which let's her attack me under tower.

{{champion:555}}

The problem is less that she is "safe" in general, it's more she is "safe" in sustained fights because of shroud.

When she was announced to be reworked, a lot of players rejoiced that shroud would be changed to be more healthy. Instead riot removed the PinkWard strategy and gave her true stealth and a shroud that extended the duration when she ran in and out.
Like just about everything now days Riot listened and went the OPPOSITE direction with it.

Thing is, she is pretty much the only assassin who needs to commit to sustained fights so she actually needs a safety tool like that. Which even with her shroud makes her infinitely more fair than likes of Zed, LB or Fizz who jump at you from half a screen away, delete you in 0.5 seconds and then jump back before your team can retaliate.

That being said, invisibility to turrets is still BS. Get rid of that and she'd be fine.

Leave them be, they don't look at details, just at what they hate.

"I hate she has healing" - well, why does she need it? She's melee, has little range, can't engage from a distance if the enemy knows a little positioning, is tanky as wet tissue and is bad when behind.

"I hate her invis" - well, why does she need to have the best invis in the game? Again, she's melee, has little range, has the lowest TTK of all Assassins because she doesn't have that much damage early.

Like, for 90% of things, there's a reason for why they are there, even tho currently, they aren't needed anymore in some cases, like Zed's passive applying on creeps.
That can be said about a TON of champs.

I personally feel that akali's dmg is fine but the fact she can just cast a spell then wait in shroud is a bit unfair, the difference between old akali and new is that her q would require an auto to proc any dmg, but new akali gets MUCH more dmg just for landing the q instead of a small initial dmg then a proc, and one of the most unfun mechanics is true stealth, stealth within reason like twitches and evelyns make sense but ones like akali's are much harder to balance around and annoying to play around due to skill shots having to be shot in the dark and with extra movement speed she can dodge it anyways, as an example if you hit her all the way to the left and a silhouette appears then by the next spell she can be all the way to the right with just (example boots and lichbane), or in teamights she puts the adc at a disadvantage with the fact that HE CANT HIT HER so they get forced out of fights or risk there life to pump in some teamfight dmg leaving most the time only top and mid and less often junglers to take care of akali thanks to aoe abilities.There needs to be counterplay to true stealth for adcs specifically because they focus on auto attacks and single target dmg most of the cases. such as if an single target ability hits a true stealthed enemy akali,khazix,shaco there is sight granted to the specific champion that hit the enemy with a single target ability and they will be granted sight for a second or two I feel this would offer a chance to the adc and to the assassin since only they can see each other but feel something like that shouldn't apply to aoe dmg or auto attacks and maybe an effect would appear like a truesight eyeball would appear on them during this just to catch the person who hit the enemy assassins attention.This is just my opinion but i dont think nerfs/buffs will fix the current type of gameplay to be anti annoying for stealth champions and the more stealth that is introduced the more of a problem it will become.

kind of late but, as you can see. All assassins have something that will make other players go:
yeh I'm not ganking that lane.
and the only reason the assassin player dies is if he or she went to deep in and forgot to go back as they can always have ways to go back.

That's all. Akali uses W for farming and trading. Leblank uses W for farming and trading, so does Zed, and so does Fizz.
With Ekko and Talon using their escapes less during normal laning phase, so, actually, those two are more difficult to gank or kill if you can't just bait them.

My point is: riot always had this stupid design to make assassins: go in and out easily.
But the problem with that stupid design is: when the assassins are good, they go in and out and the enemy can't do shit about them.
And when the assassins are bad, they go in, don't do shit, and get out without having done anything, or they die because they tried to do more than their numbers allow to burst right now.

Its basically riot's design core: assassins have shitload of mobility and lane safety, so that they can get to their mid game faster and kill people.
Which is why I prefer assassins like Rengar, Diana, Akali (before rework), as they have to go in, and going out, they have to make sure they get out via their own skills and predictions and decisions in which situations to jump or not.
